Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan1Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: Real estate is expensive in Singapore so most hotels have steep prices for broom closet sized rooms. This hotel however has quite good sized hallways, rooms and bathrooms. Bigger than most. But, that is where the feeling of luxury ends. The hotel also serves as a language center which might be the reason why the cafe and restaurant areas are dark (to save electricity perhaps?) and very very basic. The hallways smell clean but the chemical smell is rather "in your face". For food a small shop next to the lobby area sells fruit juices, some sandwiches and some local foods, for anything more you really need to go out. Out is about a 15 to 20 minute walk to the famous Orchard street with it's many Starbucks and other western brandstores. That is also where all the public transport is. With the temprature being what it is in Singapore, that means taxis are needed and that can be a problem. The hotel is not on a busy street and the only service the hotels offers to help you is that a sign and a revolving light by the roadside are lit so that passing taxis know there are people waiting. There appears to be a shortage of cabs because several times we had to wait for more than 20 minutes. And when it rains, everyone wants a taxi. Unlike other hotels in the city, whos names you see on umbrellas all around you, this hotel does not have umbrellas for its guests to borrow which I found strange during the rainy season.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Big Roms, poor breakfast, away from Public Transport.”
Reviews.Author: Felix T
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and kept in a good and clean condition. The staff is friendly and helpfull. The breakfast is Asian style and disappointing compared to room quality. You will spend some more dollars on taxis, as Hotel is located quite a walk from any facilities away and public transport does not get there.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: Domiline C
Reviews.Content: The room is very spacious, with very good bathrooms, warm water, clean restrooms, free drinking water, large nice soft beds, big TV and accommodating staff =)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious!”
Reviews.Author: travelgaljkt
Reviews.Content: Spacious! Close to orchard rd. bus still have to take taxi, or you can walk I guess. Amenities are the bare minimum, but hey if you're going to go shopping all day, all we need is a comfy clean bed, clean shower, hot water, and blockout blinds so we can sleep in until 9. Highly recommend this hotel! great bargain near Orchard rd.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LeonieLordHoweIsland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 nights over christmas for a family gathering and found the hotel more than adequate for our needs. Rooms large and clean with rainshower and usual amenities.Approx a 15 min easy walk to the beginning of Orchard Ave. Small shop on site had drinks and snacks and other essentials for purchase (very cheap). An asian style buffet breakfast was available for purchase which we didn't need to utilise so cannot comment on it. Reception staff were slow in communicating problem of phone which was never fixed, as we had 2 rooms on different floors made for constant lift usage. Free wifi was a bonus for contacting friends and other family over the festive season. Especially for the location and price would recommend hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location with large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: HelenGomez
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for what we wanted. Great location only ten minute walk from Orchard Road, Huge Rooms and Free Wired Internet. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and able to answer many questions that we had. The room was huge and extremely clean and well looked after. We had two double beds in our room which was great. The shower was a rain shower and very good and the bathroom was kept very clean. Free internet in a hotel is quite rare in singapore and this was a good point. We will definitely would recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: UmutA
Reviews.Content: Not far from Orchard road, just a few minutes walk. The rooms are really big and the balconies are also nice. Breakfast is very poor. There's a small kiosk where you can buy some other things to eat. Not an excellent place but it's ok if you're looking for something comfortable and cosy.

Reviews.Title: “Restfully nice”
Reviews.Author: pnair
Reviews.Content: This plave is far from the maddening crowd that fills Orchard Road and yet only a 10 min(really) only 10 mins walk from Orchard Towers. Rooms were big and comfortable for a family of 4. No food in the hotel but since it is 10 mins away from Orchard Road it was not a problem at all. Staff were friendly & helpful. Taxis readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Very Spacious room with Balcony for Money Paid”
Reviews.Author: GOWRISHANKAR
Reviews.Content: When i first entered the hotel i thought the rooms will not be much good like that of a star hotels... But when i checked in i found the room is much spacious than the hotel where i previously stayed... And more over i had a Balcony and location is also prime near to Orchard road... The TV channels are not available as expected. And we have not had food here so no idea how the food is...

Reviews.Title: “Try another...”
Reviews.Author: Bielbo75
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with Shuggy66 give it a miss we stay there just recently for 2 nights, November 2011 .I felt this hotel did not feel like a hotel, it was depressing the minute you went in, my heart just sank through the floor.Its a learning centre and when you check in you go thur these other doors which takes you to the foyer of the learning centre weird for a hotel its co-shared with them...When the lift opened on 11th floor the smell was awful like a smoking room but as you come out of the lift it says no smoking, our clothes were disgusting after two we we got home everything stank of smoke even the suitcase itself... The restaurant food looks like a school canteen not a restaurant. Don't be fooled by the web site and its pictures. I really dont know why aiswarya nitinkhedkar are talking about giving it 5 and 4 stars other than they must work there or be students would are staying there...Also its not just $200 a nite there are a few extra fees gst ansd another extra $44.00 a night on top of your Try somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “RELC Singapore Hotel review”
Reviews.Author: nitinkhedkar
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay and good experience with RELC international Hotel, Singapore. Support staff and cleanliness is very good. Also its value for money hotel. We were there for 4 nights and had a good time. Hotel has very good view and surrounding. Hotel staff will assist you for anything which you required starting from tour booking etc.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: Shuggy66
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed that there are any good reviews here. I know it is at the low price end but shopping arround you can do much better. I only spent half an hour here, put bags in the room, went out and found another hotel, returned and checked out. I felt this hotel did not feel like a hotel, it was depressing the minute you went in, my heart just sank through the floor. When the lift opened on 17th floor the smell was awful like a pet hamster cage in need of cleaning out. The room had adjoining room doors which I never feel comfortable with. No room service either. As I checked out imediately I cannot comment further but those who mention the poor restaurant food don't mention that it looks like a school canteen not a restaurant. Don't be fooled by the web site and its pictures.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Karthick P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days with my wife, kid and my parents. The rooms were large and comfortable and the staff was very obliging. We arrived hours earlier than 12.00 PM when our day's booking was to start, but the staff gave us one of two rooms in half an hour. We got the other room in another hour - all at no extra cost. The beds were comfortable and large. There was constant hot water supply, the bathrooms were sanitised and clean. It was perfectly suitable for our family. They have a good breakfast spread too. Must also say that this is a budget establishment and there seem to be more seminars happening there too. There's a sightseeing bus run by Singapore Tourism which can take you around. It comes to the hotel in the morning. Check at the reception for details.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bluemoon899
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 days with my wife and 2 small kids. The room we stayed in was at 15th Floor was big, clean and comfortable with contemparary design which was much to our liking. We had booked 2 super size single beds but the hotel was kind enough to provide us an extra single bed free of charge. I agree with most reviews here on the limited choices of breakfast and facilities. Nonetheless, for the price we paid for and since we were going sightseeing around Singapore, we could not ask for more. If you have small kids like mine, walking to Orchard Road is quite a challenge and tiring. It's at least 800 Km away from the hotel. Cabs are easily available but it's pretty expensive by Malaysian standard due to the unfavorable exchange rate. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful, contrary to some reviews I have read. I'd definately recommend this hotel to anyone who would just like to get a comfortable place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Good with qualifications”
Reviews.Author: lmsssa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RELC International Hotel for a week in July 2011. The hotel is clean, the rooms are large, the meeting rooms are a good size with appropriate equipment, the auditorium is quite large, comfortable, and again well-equipped. The staff is friendly and helpful. Prices are in-line with Singapore hotels.The only issue I have is the food is specifically focussed on Chinese consumers, hence the breakfast buffet, though not expensive, is relatively unpleasant for anyone expecting any Western dishes. No room service. There are snack bars with minimal offerings. A decent, very inexpensive continental breakfast can be constructed from Red Bean Buns (buns with a sweet and tasty bean paste filling) and coffee at the ground floor snack bar. A Shangri-La Hotel is a block away with a gigantic buffet breakfast, but with a somewhat shocking S$50 per person charge for non-hotel guests. Orchard Road is a somewhat long walk away. Singapore taxis are high quality and amongst the cheapest in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel not to return to”
Reviews.Author: dekpendi
Reviews.Content: We were family of 4 staying for 2 nights for short holiday in singapore. Our first time to see hotel staff eating and talking loudly in front of guests when we came for breakfast at 2nd floor in 1st morning. We were asked to pay additional for my kid, which was fine for us. The lady staff it was $5 but the tall man with tie said $7. They were just not friendly at all, no smile nor service attitude at all. They kept watching us and talking while we were having breakfast. We were truly disappointed even more when knowing that they were only friendly and greeting other guests of the same race as them.. unbeliavable, discirimination is still happening here.. They didnt even say any word when we paid, nor eye contact at all. Check in process and room was ok, but again no smile at all. Does smile cost much for them?? No pool, so not suitable at all for family travelling with kids. Seeing such rude staff had made us aware that good service is just not yet a culture in this hotel. Hope not to experience this kind of nightmare in our next holiday... Definitely this is not a hotel to return to... Regards

Reviews.Title: “Will recommend if someone is looking to cut costs”
Reviews.Author: INTIMETRAVELS
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the RelC International for 3 ngts ,after staying for 1 ngt at the Siloso Beach Resort, the hotel has outstanding rooms very large 450 sq. ft awesome bathrooms, very spacious and superb, but the breakfast was the most horrendous fare ever, really bad smelling of stinky meat all the time, unhygenic plates and spoons and other than eggs all singapore dishes, the cafetaria is run by a local and is not part of the hotel, the staff at the cafe is downright rude, the breakfast absolutely chilled except for the only edible toast which was warm beacuse we taosted it, the hotel is attached to a language college, though that was not much of a hinderance but the next hair raising issue was getting a taxi to get out, it was quite a pain sometimes,and if you book a cab you pay 3 SGD extra so one wonders on a total 6 SGD fare to Clarke Quay should one pay 3 SGD extra...............on the whole a soso experience

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, lovely spacious rooms!!”
Reviews.Author: anupur
Reviews.Content: Chose RELC mainly for its location. ten minutes walk from Orchard Road, it is loacted in a quiet residential area of Singapore. The rooms were amazingly huge- the biggest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in and the staff was very helpful and polite. The only drawback was the Chinese Breakfast- no milk , no cereal, no cake or cookies, no fresh juice. Our kids and my vegetarian Mom had a hard time. They only served rice, noodles, soup and soy milk etc.. and the kids ended up eating only bread, butter and jam every one of the five days we were there and eventually got fed up and left the hotel hungry in the morning. This hotel is no-no for Indians and people who cannot tolerate seafood smeel at breakfast time!! The hotel should live up to its "international" title.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, AC was bad”
Reviews.Author: Shahzeb019
Reviews.Content: This was an ok hotel. Room spacious and service was alright. Provided us our extra added bed quite quickly. However, room aircondition was inadequate, sometimes cooled up but most times did not. Considering the heat in Singapore, AC condition was a real dampener.

Reviews.Title: “Walkable to Orchard Rd. Free wifi. Gym with weights.”
Reviews.Author: rmm69
Reviews.Content: All in all a pleasant stay at the RELC. The place functions as a language college but this didn't really affect my stay. As the other reviewers have mentioned, the rooms really are massive - which is a plus if this is what you are into. I was in an east facing room, with a balcony, which enabled me to watch the red singapore sunrises whilst sipping the complementary tea. Bed was comfy, clean, nothing super fancy, just nice. Facilities: Free wifi. The gym has a treadmill, weights, a stepper and a weights machine (level 8). There is a cafe on level 1 and also a restaurant on level 2. Some of the information in the room booklet is out of date - gym location for example. So be sure to check with the front desk to be sure. Neighbourhood: Not much immediately around the hotel. It is about a 10 minute walk into orchard road (but not central orchard rd), so you can catch a bus from there or keep walking to hit the Tangs/ION shopping centre junction (where scotts rd intersects with orchard).

Reviews.Title: “nothing compares”
Reviews.Author: rfanwar
Reviews.Content: The hotel room clean and huge, frontliners superb...excellence...especially mr adam and khrisnan...unfortunately no room service available for 24 hrs.....everything elses two thumbs up...

Reviews.Title: “It's a nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Thassha
Reviews.Content: Very nice reception during daytime. The best receptionist we've ever met. He helped many people to look around Singapore as Singaporean do. Room is big and clean. I don't want to talk about a receptionist at night-time:( Next to the hotel had noisy construction during daytime. Helpful manager.

Reviews.Title: “NIce & Resonable Price”
Reviews.Author: JollyWong
Reviews.Content: Simple & tidy Newly renovated Unexpected large room (big enough for family w/ kids) Resonable price even during big event Formula 1 Location is fine & quiet, about 20mins to MRT, 12-15mins to Orchard Rd (the walk is quite enjoyable) would like to stay again if go to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “RELC - Great roomy rooms, clean and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: JakartaSmiley
Reviews.Content: For this year trip, we went to RELC instead of Bencoolen Hotel. From the site the hotel looks big, clean and nice. Our organizer in Singapore prefer this hotel than Bencoolen Hotel as RELC in better building and management, but not in better location. From the map it looks very close to Orchard Rd, but the group are complaining the first time we went to the hotel as it took more than a 5-10 minutes walk as they stated in their web. No MRT station, or bus station nearby/ But, a taxi to Orchard Road only cost you $ Sgd 4. No big deal :) The building is in excellent conditions. Rooms are newly renovated. Love the big roomy room with comfy bed and giant Plasma TV (too bad no World Cup channel at that point). Bathroom are clean and new. You could fit 3-4 persons in one double renovated room. The hotel is big with a large parking area. Breakfast very standard, I prefer you go down to Orchard road and get your breakfast there. Staff are very helpful. Doing the booking online, get booking code and the checking in for my group of 10 (ten) pax, took such a breeze. We don't even have to sign or write anything! Maybe because we booked in group booking. And I think this hotel is good at handling group booking, as this hotel is famous as a conference hotel. Overall, the hotel is good, worth the price, but not in perfect location. Defenitely would come there again!

Reviews.Title: “Superb Holiday Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Joles2311
Reviews.Content: My husband of 8 months and I spent our first holiday together at the RELC in Singapore. The place was fantastic, clean and comfortable. We were jetlagged and yet felt like home and were able to relax and sightsee and come in for a nap whenever. The hotel is just off Orchard Road, which made for a suitable walk to town and back. We loved it and would book in there once more for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Please give it a MISS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MMDAS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in RELC for one night at the start of our holidays on 19.11.08. I was very disappointed with the hotel. To start with, the reception was cold. The room was spacious with a decent balcony but was shabby and short of amenities. The balcony was all covered up so it was no fun standing there in the oppressive Singapore weather. I paid SG$200 for the night and hence was not amused. The location was in a residential area and away from everything and I regretted my choice. RELC basically run courses in the same building and are more focussed on that than the hotel business. At SG$200 you can have a lot of choices in Singapore- I stayed afterwards in Park Royale on Kitchener Road at SG$170 and that is a 4 star hotel (booked through WOTIF.com)

Reviews.Title: “A nice & clean Hotel at a good location with a very nice staff....”
Reviews.Author: ColomboExplorer
Reviews.Content: A nice & clean Hotel at a good location with a very nice staff. If you are using a budget room you have to share the bathroom, so it depends upon with whom you have to share it. So, its safer to go for a higher level. Breakfast is something I never enjoyed.. its just a breakfast, except for the Spring Rolls. But you cant complain. Other than that, its a very clean hotel, with a good service. Specially the staff at the front office is very helpful and kind. They became good friends with us, which made us sad to leave the Hotel. How we booked the hotel??.. we just called them directly over the phone and some lady took the booking verbally. We got a reference number. It was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money - good location”
Reviews.Author: dsim
Reviews.Content: a nice traveller class hotel. located in orange grove road, tanglin side of orchard road. its quite a walk from hotel to tanglin mall and orchard road, but the street its well lit at night. just dont get caught in the rain. there's a bus #36 serving that road, not sure if it stops at orchard road and near the hotel. hotel offers breakfast. if u check-out early the next day, you can pass the breakfast coupons to the cafeteria the day prior to check-out (before it closes at 7pm); and the cafeteria will pack some sandwich and packet juice for you to bring along the next day. executive room is spacious, with bath tub & shower, basic toileteries, water boiler, fridge, tv & a balcony. good for those on transit for a night or two in singapore, but not for those hardcore shoppers (quite a walk back to hotel from orchard road) - but then again taxi is plenty. staffs are courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: fluffybeee
Reviews.Content: this is a fantstic place to stay! travelled with friends and stayed in their 'student' rooms which has 2 twin rooms sharing a lobby, balcony and bathroom (not shown on their website). there was also a communual kitchen area on the floor with cold & boiling water, ice, fridge/freezers and microwave. the staff were very friendly, booked by email with no problems, they allowed us to check in early at no extra cost, all staff were helpful and even remembered our room no's! the location was good, on a quiet road and 10mins walk to orchard road. our rooms were basic but had everything you needed, clean bedding, plenty of storage (even with 2 girls sharing a room!) and air-con. the phone in the room was very cheap to use even for international calls - S$5 for 10min UK phone call = £1.60! and certainly no problems with smell/ants/bugs as some people have said. we found the breakfast was just what you required: toast, eggs, cereal, porridge, tea/coffee/squash, and probably the best of all was the daily selection of hot food usually a noodle dish with accompaniments like fish balls or samosas (which were excellent!) - singaporeans eat lunch/dinner things for breakie which may not suit everyone, but there was enough normal things to keep you going - singapore is full of wonderful restaurants! i would definitely stay in the same rooms again if travelling with friends or go for a double room if with my partner. the RELC was excellent value for money and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Good for Family”
Reviews.Author: sklee
Reviews.Content: the plus+ checking in was professional n swift. they booked me on the 15th floor. was thoroughly glad with the standard big room with 2 queens. they were absolutely proactive by giving me an enclosed balcony for my 2 year old to roam about. don bother using online booking.just call the hotel and look for manager on duty.u may be offered special promo deals which are cheaper during non peaks and u get immediate resonse n requests. hey, it's only 10 minutes walk to Orchard (Tanglin side). good walking shoes are a must. one way peak hour cab to middle of orchard shopping can run up to $6-$7 (inc surcharges). minus- breakfast was very basic ..well almost 'canteen'like. boiled eggs, toasts and fried noodles etc are the daily order. bed sheets are not changed daily. so stay put in room until about 9.30ish and make sure the nice housekeeper change the sheets. was lucky to have talked to Adam ('adaam'). he certainly went beyond his duty call to delight customers. 2 cheers to his crew as well. We may just go back if the rates stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price For Location”
Reviews.Author: jbdavis99
Reviews.Content: It's hard to complain about the Hollywood Queen Room (2 beds for 4 people) for SGD 120 per night on Orange Grove near Orchard Road (15 min walk). That's a good Price for Location in the Orchard Road area. The breakfast included was not much to write home about. The convenience store and cafe shut down early. There is a free shuttle to Orchard Road and other places. No swimming pool is a downside for kids. Staff was friendly & helpful. You can purchase a pre-paid card for internet access. The hotel seems a little old and tired, but acceptable and plenty of staff to attend to things. I found a bug in the bathroom, but I find the same things at my home. OK for 2 nights on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “musty relc”
Reviews.Author: walkie
Reviews.Content: Was overwhelmed by the musty, smell the second I opened the room door. it was just so overpowering. opening the balcony windows didn't help. hotel should seriously consider stripping carpet off room. couldn't sleep well because of the

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in RELC”
Reviews.Author: ChinaM
Reviews.Content: I got a Hollywood's Queen room for four, we had 2 queen sized bed and since I travelled with my sister and parents - it was perfect. I was given a room in the non-smoking floor and it was as seen in the website. We had an extension area (sort of a balcony) which was great - although for those who may want open windows...their windows just open partially more of a safety feature I think. The room was very clean and did not smell musty, CR fully working too along with water heater and other amenities. The hotel was fully booked since there was a convention (RELC is a regional language center) yet it still maintained its tranquility and the staff were inobtrusive yet helpful. The complimentary breakfast though is not so exciting, we had noodles, boiled eggs and congee for breakfast the 2 days we were there. Though for the non-picky, the fare is ok and you can just opt to go for a sumptuous lunch and dinner in the city. For those who love the quiet, this is a good place to stay. After walking so much and doing sightseeing OR even a day's training or work in singapore......the quiet area of orange grove is ideal. There is a regular free shuttle that brings you to main orchard and should you opt for taxis, the area is not too isolated so there will be taxis coming along every so often. The location is not too far also from the shopping malls, in the map it may seem so far but in reality it is not. But then location of the place to stay will also depend where one opts to go so they can be nearer. Will I recommend? Why not? The staff were polite and helpful and overall my stay was just right.

Reviews.Title: “Don't listen to the hype”
Reviews.Author: jonorose
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews here and expected an incredible bargain from this "hotel". I was extremely dissapointed. First of all the breakfast is absolutely horrible. Next, the rooms (I stayed in a Hollywood Queen) are admittedly clean and comfortable, but awefully drab. The location is pleasant, but quite far from anything you'll want to do. Orchard Road is about a 10 minute walk. The worst of it was the broadband internet connection which was ludicrously expensive in a city where you can find free hotspots all over the place. Take my advice, and take your laptop to the nearest Starbucks or Coffee Bean, and work there. Finally, I have to say that it just didn't feel like a hotel at all. Having said all that, I'm probably gonna stay there again, since it really is quite cheap. Just don't expect a fancy hotel. It isn't.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel in Singapore, good for value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just magneficent. The rooms were big, clean and bright. We stayed in here for two nights and we experienced living in a five star hotel but we only paid a two star hotel's price. We stayed in the Hollywood Queen room (it has two queen sized beds) and they only charged us with about $110 Singapore dollars. We reckon that this was a great value for money. The hotel staff were very helpful indeed. We recommend any visitors visiting Singapore to stay in this lovely hotel. Just splendid.

Reviews.Title: “Size of room = great value for money”
Reviews.Author: TeddyN
Reviews.Content: If it hasn't been said before, I'll say it here - the RELC is fantastic value for money due the large clean rooms with a great location - Orange Grove Road is a lovely residential road off the Orchard main drag - this road incidentally also houses the Shangri-La. If you're not up to the 8-10 minute walk, there is a shuttle bus from the RELC to take you down to Orchard Road and beyond. My high-floor room also offered very attractive views from the balcony, which is also of very generous proportions. Just a tip: If you're wondering whether to have a lie-in or go down to get the free breakfast, opt for the lie-in.

HotelInfo.Name: RELC International Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 30 Orange Grove Road, Singapore 258352, Singapore
